title: MSCMPE - Master of Science in Computer Engineering
description: Master of Science in Computer Engineering (MS-CMPE) program requirements, including core courses, specialization tracks, elective courses, writing requirement, and culminating experience.
prerequisite(s): Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
Competency in programming, computer systems, and engineering principles recommended
notes: Students must complete a minimum of 30 units
Students must pass the Graduation Writing Assessment Requirement (GWAR)
Completion of a project or thesis is required

System Software Architecture.overview: Focuses on software architecture, system design, and high-level programming.

Network Systems.overview: Covers networking principles, protocols, and system administration.

elective_courses.overview: Students may select any graduate-level CMPE course except restricted courses.

courses.title: Computer Engineering Seminar
courses.description: Seminar covering advanced research topics in software engineering and technology.

courses.title: Engineering Reports
courses.description: Technical writing for engineers, focusing on research documentation and professional communication.

Masters Project.title: Master's Project I
Masters Project.description: Initial phase of the master's project, including research, design, and development planning.

Masters Project.title: Master's Project II
Masters Project.description: Final implementation, testing, and presentation of the master's project.

Masters Thesis.title: Master's Thesis I
Masters Thesis.description: Research and proposal development for the master's thesis in software engineering.

Masters Thesis.title: Master's Thesis II
Masters Thesis.description: Completion and defense of the master's thesis research.

graduation_requirements: Completion of Thesis or Project Report
